sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"职业"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: profession, job, occupation, trade, vocation, career, work, employment
means: profession ： 以前常指要受过高等教育(尤指法律、医学和神学)才能获得的职业，现在一般指为谋生日的职业，尤指从事脑力劳动和受过专门训练，具有某种专业知识的职业。
job ： 通常指一切有收入，不分脑力与体力运动，不论是否有技艺的长期或临时的职业。
occupation ： 泛指任何一种职业，既不分什么行业，也不管是脑力还是体力劳动。
trade ： 指需要有熟练技巧、技能和体力的职业。
vocation ： 较正式用词，语气庄重，指长期从事，但不一定以此为主计的职业。
career ： 指经过专门训练，终身愿意从事的职业。
work ： 指任何种类的工作，也泛指职业。
employment ： 指受雇于他人，领取工资以谋生计，有较固定工作的职业。

sentence.Network_en: Current employment laws will be changed to reward effort and punish laziness.

sentence.Network_en: More local employment will be created, particularly in service industries.

entry.def: Employment is the fact of having a paid job.

example.ex: She was unable to find employment...
He regularly drove from his home to his place of employment.
example.tran: 他定期开车往返于家和工作地点之间。

entry.def: Employment is the fact of employing someone.

example.tran: 对不满9岁的儿童的雇用

entry.def: Employment is the work that is available in a country or area.

example.ex: ...economic policies designed to secure full employment.
example.tran: 旨在确保充分就业的经济政策

Sentence.sentence: Under these circumstances, it's natural to look for what may appear to be the most "practical" way out of the problem "Major in a subject designed to get you a job" seems the obvious answer to some, though this ignores the fact that many disciplines in the humanities characterized as "soft" often, in fact, lead to employment and success in the long run.
It's true that if total employment were higher, it would mean more jobs for all of us to choose from (and compete for).
Mothers are far more likely than fathers to take advantage of this law,But extended leaves and part-time employment are known to be harmful to careers—for both genders.
And with women a second factor comes into play:most seem to enjoy the flexible-time arrangement(once known as the "mommy track")and never find their way back to full-time or high-level employment
A 2012 press release from Statistics Sweden bears the title "Gender Equality in Sweden Treading(踩)Water" and notes: 1、The total income from employment for all ages is lower for women than for men

jushi.english: The employment of force by the police seemed to be necessary.
jushi.chinese: 看来警察使用武力是必要的。

jushi.english: She enjoyed most her employment as babysitter.
jushi.chinese: 她非常喜欢保姆的工作。
